This article is about the creature. For the captured version, see Dragon impling jar.
Dragon impling
Released11 June 2007 (Update)
MembersYes
RaceImpling
LocationMost likely Puro-Puro, but can be almost anywhere.
OptionsCatch
ExamineAn impling who likes the word 'dragon'.
Advanced data
NPC ID1644,1654

The Dragon impling is the second highest impling that can be caught in the Impetuous Impulses minigame, and are located throughout Puro-Puro and Gielinor. The player needs at least 83 Hunter (or level 80-82 with a hunter potion) to capture this type of impling. At level 93, dragon implings can be caught bare-handed. Capturing a dragon impling grants 65 Hunter experience if caught in Puro-Puro, or 300 Hunter experience if caught outside of Puro-Puro, throughout Gielinor.

The Dragon impling is the second rarest impling for players to catch. You can't take dragon implings onto Entrana, as looting them may give you weapons.

Contents

  • 1 Rarity
  • 2 Hunter info
  • 3 Loot
    • 3.1 Tertiary
  • 4 Changes

Rarity[edit | edit source]

In Puro-Puro, the chance of a Dragon impling spawning in a rare impling spot (Nature impling and above) is 3%. In Gielinor, this increases to 10%.

The best method to get a dragon impling to spawn in Puro-Puro is to catch all other types of rare implings (Nature, Magpie and Ninja). This will cause rare implings to continuously spawn, with the chance of it being a dragon impling each time.

Loot[edit | edit source]

At current Grand Exchange prices, opening a Dragon impling jar gives 164,127 worth of loot, on average. This means opening dragon impling jars marks an average loss −264,839 coins per jar, however this does not include loot from clue scrolls.

On average, one would lose −13,241,934 coins to get an elite clue scroll from dragon impling jars at current Grand Exchange prices, excluding the rewards from the completed Treasure Trails.

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
21 April 2016
(update | poll)
  • Implings can now be caught barehanded, without a net, and those outside Puro Puro do not require a jar.
  • Elite clue scrolls have been added to dragon impling drop tables.
